title: The Public’s Role in COVID-19 Vaccination
itunes:title: The Public’s Role in COVID-19 Vaccination
description:
Monica Schoch-Spana, Medical Anthropologist at the Johns Hopkins Center for Health Security, discusses the public’s role in COVID-19 vaccination. Bloomberg Healthcare Reporter Michelle Cortez shares her insight onCOVID antibodies fading rapidly and the implications that has on immunity. Bloomberg Businessweek Editor Joel Weber and Bloomberg Projects & Investigations Reporter Lauren Etter walk through Juul quietly revamping its e-cigarette, risking the FDA’s rebuke. And we Drive to the Close with Deepak Puri, CIO Americas at Deutsche Bank Wealth Management.

Hosts: Carol Massar and Jason Kelly. Producer: Doni Holloway. 

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
